Plotly Biodiversity Dashboard

This interactive Plotly dashboard is written in Javascript and charts the individual results of a trial on the biodiversity of test subjects' bellybuttons. Bateria types are measured in OTU's, which defines closely related groups of individuals. These charts populate with the 10 most common OTU families, charting their relative frequency on the bar and bubble charts. A new patient can be chosen by selecting their ID with the selector on the top left. Their demographic information occupies the left panel, and the gauge tracks the number of times they washed their navel during the trial. This dashboard has style changes not found in the original repo.

Go to Github Repo
